sections.title: Financial performance of your business

pages.title: Was the financial performance of [Ru Name] outside of normal expectations in the last two weeks?
pages.description: Normal expectations means normal for this time of year, or as a result of expected outcomes of standard business activities
pages.definitionContent: This means usual for this time of year, or as a result of expected outcomes of standard business activities.

pages.title: Was [Ru Name]'s turnover within its normal range in the last two weeks?
pages.description: 'Normal range' means within expectations for this time of year, or as a result of expected outcomes of standard business activities

options.label: Yes, it was within the normal range
No, it was outside the normal range

pages.definitionContent: This means within expectations for this time of year, or as a result of expected outcomes of standard business activities.

pages.title: In what way was [Ru Name]'s turnover outside its normal range in the last two weeks?
pages.guidance:
Exclude:

  • change expected due to seasonal effects
  • change expected due to normal patterns of business activity

pages.title: What do you think were the main causes for [Ru Name]'s turnover being outside its normal range in the last two weeks?
Please explain in more detail why [Ru Name]'s turnover was affected
What are your expectations about [Ru Name]'s turnover in the next two weeks?

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same

pages.title: Has [Ru Name]'s exporting of goods or services been affected by the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak in the last two weeks?
Please explain in more detail how [Ru Name]'s exporting has been affected
What are your expectations about [Ru Name]'s exporting of goods or services in the next two weeks?
Was [Ru Name]'s importing of materials, goods or services affected by the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak in the last two weeks?
Please explain in more detail how [Ru Name]'s importing has been affected
What are your expectations about [Ru Name]'s importing of materials, goods or services in the next two weeks?
Was [Ru Name] able to get the materials, goods or services it needed from within the UK in the last two weeks?

options.label: Yes, we have been able to  get what we needed
Yes, but we have had to change suppliers or find alternative solutions
No, we have not been able to get the materials, goods or services we needed

pages.title: Please explain why [Ru Name] was not able to get the materials, goods or services needed
How did the prices of materials, goods or services needed by [Ru Name] change in the last two weeks, compared with normal price fluctuations?

options.label: Some prices increased, some prices decreased

pages.title: Please give more details about the prices of materials, goods or services that changed
What are your expectations about changes in prices of materials, goods or services that [Ru Name] needs for the next two weeks?
Did [Ru Name] have to change the prices of your goods or services that were sold in the last two weeks?

options.label: Yes, we generally had to increase our prices
Yes, we generally had to decrease our prices
No, we did not have to change our prices

pages.title: Please give more details about how prices changed
What are your expectations about prices of goods or services that [Ru Name] will sell over the next two weeks?
Has [Ru Name]s ability to access financial resources changed in the last two weeks?

options.label: Yes, access to finance has increased
Yes, access to finance has decreased
No, access to finance has stayed the same

pages.title: How confident are you that [Ru Name] has the financial resources to continue operating throughout the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak?

sections.introductionContent:
This section asks for information on any changes during the last two weeks, and expectations for the next two weeks, to:

  • your business's turnover
  • your business's imports and exports
  • the availability and prices of materials, goods and services
  • your business's financial resources

sections.title: Operational performance of your business

pages.title: Was [Ru Name]'s workforce able to meet the demands of the business in the last two weeks?

options.label: Yes, the workforce could meet the business's demands
No, the workforce could not meet the business's demands

pages.title: What measures has [Ru Name] taken to cope with the impact of coronavirus (COVID-19) on your workforce?

options.label: Staff are encouraged to work from home
Staff have to work from home
Laying off staff in the short term
Recruiting staff for the short term

pages.title: In the last two weeks, roughly what proportion of your workforce was doing each of the following?

answers.description: Include those who are normally remote workers
answers.label: Working at their normal place of work

answers.description: Exclude those who are normally remote workers
answers.label: Working remotely instead of at their normal place of work

pages.title: Do you expect [Ru Name]'s workforce size to change over the next two weeks due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak?

options.label: Expect workforce size to stay the same

sections.introductionContent: This section asks you for information on any changes to the size and capacity of your workforce during the last two weeks, and expectations over the next two weeks.

sections.title: Other financial or operational changes

pages.title: Were there any other changes to financial or operational activities for [Ru Name] that were unexpected in the last two weeks?
pages.definitionLabel: Examples of financial and operational activities
pages.definitionContent:
• Investment impacts
  • Stock changes
  • Widening or changing the range of goods and/or services produced

pages.title: Please give more details about any other unexpected changes to financial or operational activities
pages.definitionLabel: Examples of financial and operational activities
pages.definitionContent:
• Investment impacts
  • Stock changes
  • Widening or changing the range of goods and/or services produced

pages.title: Are you expecting any other financial and/or operational activities at [Ru Name] to be affected by the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak over the next two weeks?

options.label: Yes, I expect other financial and/or operational activities to be affected
No, I do not expect any other financial and/or operational activities to be affected

pages.definitionLabel: Examples of financial and operational activities
pages.definitionContent:
• Investment impacts
  • Stock changes
  • Widening or changing the range of goods and/or services produced

pages.title: Please give more details about what other financial and/or operational activities at [Ru Name] you think will be affected in the next two weeks
pages.definitionLabel: Examples of financial and operational activities
pages.definitionContent:
• Investment impacts
  • Stock changes
  • Widening or changing the range of goods and/or services produced

pages.title: Why do you think [Ru Name] will not have any issues due to coronavirus (COVID-19) over the next two weeks?

sections.introductionContent: This section asks for information on any other changes to financial and/or operational activities not already covered in the last two weeks, and expectations over the next two weeks.

pages.title: Let us know anything else that you think may help us understand the impact of coronavirus (COVID-19) on [Ru Name]

introduction.title: You are completing this for trad_as (ru_name)
introduction.description:
• Your response will help us provide real-time information during the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak.
  • Information will be used by government to make crucial decisions for the population and the UK economy.

Thank you for completing this short survey at this challenging time.
introduction.secondaryDescription:
• Information should relate to the UK.
  • You do not need to provide actual data.
  • We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

collapsibles.title: Section one: Financial performance of your business
collapsibles.description:
This section asks for information on any changes during the last two weeks, and expectations for the next two weeks, to:

  • your business's turnover
  • your business's imports and exports
  • the availability and prices of materials, goods and services
  • your business's financial resources

collapsibles.title: Section two: Operational performance of your business
collapsibles.description: This section asks for information any changes to the size and capacity of your workforce during the last two weeks and expectations for the next two weeks.
